title.narrative: F.a: Strengthening of Trade Union Structures in Mining Sector

description.narrative: The project improves working conditions and collective bargaining of the mining sector workers in Latin America. Workers in mining sector work in extremely dangerous conditions, occupational health and safety measures are often inadequate or even non-exist ent and the regulation of the sector is poor. Out-sourcing and use of contract agency labor are increasing rapidly: in some mines as much as 75-80 % of the workers work for a labor agency. The majority of mining enterprises are big multinational companies that seek tax reductions in the countries they operate in, and give high revenues to investors. Trade unions in this sector are weak and the union-to-union cooperation in national and regional level is scarce. The majority of unions are company-based whic h means that the growing number of outsourced workers haven't been able to join the unions. Weak unions haven't been able to participate proactively in political discussions on labor law revisions and in social dialogue with the companies to regulate labor conditions in the sector. This project seeks to strengthen mining sector unions' collaboration and capacities in order for them to be able to influence mining companies, government policies on natural resources and their use, and the political decisions a ffecting mining sector workers. This project strengthens mining sector workers' trade unions by creating two company-based networks of unions in two multinational companies: Glencore Xstrata and Anglo American. The beneficiaries of this project are mine wo rkers especially in the targeted multinationals Glencore Xstrata and Anglo American. The project is implemented by IndustriALL global trade union, together with its member unions in mining sector in Latin America.
